Package cs2030.simulator

Class Shop

  • java.lang.Object
    • cs2030.simulator.Shop
  • class Shop
extends java.lang.Object
    The Shop class maintains the list of servers and support queries for server.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Shop

        Shop​(int noOfServers,
     int noOfSelfCheckouts,
     double restProb,
     int length)
        Create a new shop with a given number of servicer.
        Parameters:
        noOfServers - The number of servers.
        noOfSelfCheckouts - The number of self-checkout counters.
        restProb - Probability of a server takes a break.
        length - Maximum queue length of a server.

    • Method Detail

      • find

        java.util.Optional<? extends Servicer> find​(int id)
        Find a server or self-checkout matching the given ID.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of server or self-checkout to be searched.
        Returns:
        Optional.empty if no server or self-checkout matches the given ID, or the optional of the server or self-checkout if a match is found.

      • findToServe

        java.util.Optional<? extends Servicer> findToServe​(double arrTime)
        Find a server or self-checkout to serve a customer.
        Parameters:
        arrTime - A double representing arrival time of the Customer.
        Returns:
        Optional.empty if all the server or self-checkout are occupied, or the optional of the server or self-checkout if a match is found.

      • findToWait

        java.util.Optional<? extends Servicer> findToWait()
        Find a server or self-checkout to serve a greedy customer.
        Returns:
        Optional.empty if all the servicers are full, or the optional of the server or self-checkout who have waiting capacity.

      • findForGreedyCust

        java.util.Optional<? extends Servicer> findForGreedyCust()
        Find a server or self-checkout to serve a greedy customer.
        Returns:
        Optional.empty if all the servicers are full, or the optional of the server or self-checkout with the shortest queue.

      • getRestProbability

        double getRestProbability()
        Gets the probability of a server resting.
        Returns:
        A double representing the probability of a server resting.
